name: resail
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to hold a boat race again, for a second, third, etc. time: The race was resailed on Saturday after Friday's race failed to end within the time limit. The protest was upheld, and the race was resailed.
More examplesFewer examplesThe race was abandoned and resailed shortly after the problem had been sorted out.The Italian said that his win in the re-sailed match was "a good start to the day". Brady will have to resail his match against the French champion, which he didn't finish.

a boat race that is held again, for a second, third, etc. time: The team protested and won the resail. She beat the Italian in a resail of a race they had three days ago.
More examplesFewer examplesThe German beat the reigning champion in the resail by a comfortable 27 seconds.
